perturbation.original_text: 3.4  Invoices. WGT will issue invoices for the Products ordered by Distributor      and all other amounts payable to WGT under this Agreement. Distributor will      pay WGT the full amount invoiced within thirty (30) days after the date of      WGT's invoice, unless provided otherwise on the applicable invoice, in the      lawful money of the United States of America to WGT by wire transfer of      immediately available funds to WGT's bank account number 1141139, at the      Commerce Bank of Washington, 601 Union Street, Suite 3600, Seattle, WA      98101, ABA routing number 125008013.
perturbation.changed_text: 3.4  Invoices. WGT will issue invoices for the Products ordered by Distributor      and all other amounts payable to WGT under this Agreement. Distributor will      pay WGT the full amount invoiced within sixty (60) days after the date of      WGT's invoice, unless provided otherwise on the applicable invoice, in the      lawful money of the United States of America to WGT by wire transfer of      immediately available funds to WGT's bank account number 1141139, at the      Commerce Bank of Washington, 601 Union Street, Suite 3600, Seattle, WA      98101, ABA routing number 125008013.
perturbation.explanation: Changing the payment deadline from 30 days to 60 days directly contradicts the original payment term. This creates uncertainty about the enforceable payment period, leading to potential disputes.

perturbation.original_text: The Term will automatically renew for successive additional periods of one (1) year each, provided that: (a) Distributor has made all Guaranteed Minimum Purchases and has complied with the marketing requirements under paragraph 4.1(b); (b) the parties have agreed in writing upon the Guaranteed Minimum Purchase amounts and Product price discounts for the next subsequent one (1) year renewal period; (c) neither party provided the other party with notice of such party's intention not to renew this Agreement at least thirty (30) days prior to any year's Expiration Date; and (d) neither party provided the other party with such notice as may be required pursuant to paragraphs 5.2, 5.3 or 5.4.
perturbation.changed_text: The Term will automatically renew for successive additional periods of one (1) year each, provided that: (a) Distributor has made all Guaranteed Minimum Purchases and has complied with the marketing requirements under paragraph 4.1(b); (b) the parties have agreed in writing upon the Guaranteed Minimum Purchase amounts and Product price discounts for the next subsequent one (1) year renewal period; (c) neither party provided the other party with notice of such party's intention not to renew this Agreement at least sixty (60) days prior to any year's Expiration Date; and (d) neither party provided the other party with such notice as may be required pursuant to paragraphs 5.2, 5.3 or 5.4.
perturbation.explanation: Changing the notice period for non-renewal from 30 days to 60 days contradicts the original requirement. This introduces ambiguity about the valid notice period, potentially leading to disputes regarding contract renewal.

perturbation.original_text: 5.3  Failure to Make Guaranteed Minimum Purchases. Upon any failure by      Distributor to make Gross Purchases in sufficient amounts to meet or exceed      the applicable cumulative Guaranteed Minimum Purchases, WGT may, at its      sole option and effective upon notice to Distributor, terminate this      Agreement. Distributor shall pay WGT fifty percent (50%) of the unpaid      balance of cumulative Guaranteed Minimum Purchase amounts as liquidated      damages. The parties acknowledge and agree that it would be difficult or      impossible to calculate WGT's actual damages arising from Distributor's      failure to timely pay all of the Guaranteed Minimum Purchases. Therefore,      the parties have agreed upon the above payment of liquidated damages in      lieu of WGT's claim for actual damages from such breach.
perturbation.changed_text: 5.3  Failure to Make Guaranteed Minimum Purchases. Upon any failure by      Distributor to make Gross Purchases in sufficient amounts to meet or exceed      the applicable cumulative Guaranteed Minimum Purchases, WGT may, at its      sole option and effective upon notice to Distributor, terminate this      Agreement. Distributor shall pay WGT twenty-five percent (25%) of the unpaid      balance of cumulative Guaranteed Minimum Purchase amounts as liquidated      damages. The parties acknowledge and agree that it would be difficult or      impossible to calculate WGT's actual damages arising from Distributor's      failure to timely pay all of the Guaranteed Minimum Purchases. Therefore,      the parties have agreed upon the above payment of liquidated damages in      lieu of WGT's claim for actual damages from such breach.
perturbation.explanation: Modifying the liquidated damages percentage from 50% to 25% creates a direct contradiction concerning the compensation owed upon failure to meet minimum purchase requirements. This creates uncertainty about the enforceability of either percentage, leading to potential legal disputes.
